newsitem.title: GERMANY: Deutsche appoints private banking chief.
newsitem.headline: Deutsche appoints private banking chief.

text.p: Deutsche Bank AG on Friday named former Rothschild Asset Management director Alfred Roelli as global chief investment officer of its private banking division.
Roelli, 44, will take up the newly created position on April 1 and will co-ordinate Deutsche's strategy for global investment advisory services from Frankfurt.
In a statement, Deutsche noted that the global private banking division was created during the bank's restructuring of last year.
The division brings together services provided worldwide for wealthy individuals with a need for complex and internationally-oriented investment packages, Deutsche said.
